bug.short_desc: Shorthand syntax for nested let expressions causes java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

long_desc.thetext:
Can be reproduced by parsing the following expression:
let s : String = '', i : Integer in true
Created an attachment (id=53832) Stack Trace
Stack trace attached.

Fixed two problems in the grammar definition for the let expression:
- the 'no null constraint' violation was caused by the letExpSubCS rule extracting the wrong token symbol from the production, which resulted in the attempt to add null to an EReference list
- the letExpCS rule nested the first variable most deeply, instead of highest. Thus, the nested variable declarations could not use it in initializing their own values
Note that the example provided in the description of this bug is, in fact, ill-formed. However, the IllegalArgumentException was not the appropriate response from the parser; now a SemanticException complaining of the absence of a variable initializer is thrown.

bug.short_desc: SetConfig on Linux misbehaves when security=true and java not in PATH

long_desc.thetext: As root, run ./SetConfig.sh The system replies that security is true and the root password needs to be entered. The problem is, it prompts for the password but the cursor does not stop. It hard returns to a new prompt instead and the user is unable to enter the password and cannot proceed.

What's changed to cause this regression?
The Version indicates 4.2.1, is it seen on 4.3?
Are you running SetConfig as root? If so the password prompt will not come up. If that's the case then this may need to be added to the readme.
Discussion between Samson and Joanna determined there is a workaroud, so deferring to 4.4.
Workaround is to export PATh so that the JRE is found and then you are not prompted for root password when running SetConfig.sh
In fact, the "getting_started.html" document already indicates that PATH has to be set pointing to the Java executable.

So SetConfig works fine if documentation is followed regarding the setting of the PATH. The bug remains open because SetConfig should be made more user-friendly and behave better when there is a problem finding/using java.
Changing the title to try to better reflect actual issue.
Joanna, there is a discrepancy between the OS field and the OS noted in the title. Also, if the new title is inaccurate, please correct.
Fix checked into CVS 2006/12/05 11:16 EST.

bug.short_desc: Breaking API change: ColumnViewer#getItemAt(Point)

long_desc.thetext:
The patch for bug 161399 has introduced a breaking API change:
The (package-private) class ColumnViewer got an additional method protected abstract Item getItemAt(Point point); which must be implemented by subclasses of AbstractTreeViewer.
This causes a compile error in our MockTreeViewer (in org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests).
The default implementation should return null. Thanks markus

just to not forget. I'm not happy with the current fix because it is made in ColumnViewer which is unneccessary to stay backwards compatible we only need to provide noop impl in AbstractTreeViewer!
The same applies to the methods: - TableViewer#getItem(int,int) - TreeViewer#getItem(int,int) - TableTreeViewer#getItem(int,int)
which overwrite the ColumnViewer#getItem(int,int) which works perfectly for them and we won't break backwards.
Thanks for spotting this. Fixed.
great and why not removing TableViewer#getItem(int,int), ... ?
Verified for 20061212-0100

bug.short_desc: [launcher] Understand the legal implication of the new launcher wrt to GPL'ed VM

long_desc.thetext: The work being done by Andrew on the launcher now dynamically loads a VM dll. For people willing to ship a product with Sun's VM or simply for OSes that will ship this VM , we need to understand if this model of loading a dll is suitable.

True, since the FSF regards EPL as GPL-incompatible (http://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-list.html) and that linking in a program (as opposed to forking) would consider the entire work being GPL.
However, if the code is compiled against different non-GPL interfaces (e.g. IBMs VM?) then it might not be an issue, on the proviso that the interfaces were compatible.
It may even be necessary for Sun to provide interface files that are non-GPL contaminated to allow people to do this.

To be precise, the code is likely compiled against a dll coming out of an IBM Jre, but what matters to the eclipse.exe is not the name of the library itself (which is not specified by the spec and whose name is different depending on the vm) but a wellknown entry point in this library which is specified in the spec.
However at runtime the eclipse.exe will find a VM library (using some searching policy irrelevant here), load it and invoke the "wellknown" entry point mentionned previously.

In the end, it seems to come down to understand what is covered by the term "this library" in the exception statement given in the license. Here is the excerpt: "the copyright holders of this library give you permission to link this library with independent modules to produce an executable, regardless of the license terms of these independent modules, and to copy and distribute the resulting executable under terms of your choice, provided that you also meet, for each linked independent module, the terms and conditions of the license of that module."
I suggest we avoid speculation on legal matters and instead defer to the Foundation by opening a item in IPzilla.
ipzilla does not seem to be structured to ask such questions since the only way to create a report is to fill in a contribution questionnaire.

Let's give IPZilla a try. It'll help ensure that I have the information I need to better understand the issue: the third party package you are proposing to use, where it originates from, the license that applies. In addition, you can add any additional information that you feel would be relevent such as the manner in which you intend to use the package.
Thanks, Janet
please post the IPzilla number here when created
Have we sorted out the legal questions? Can this be closed?

bug.short_desc: [Commands] Incorrect result from DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand.canExecute()

long_desc.thetext:
I create a DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand something like this:
new DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand( new CreateConnectionRequest(), new ObjectAdapter(/*blah*/), /*blah*/, /*blah*/, /*blah*/)
The command returns true from canExecute(), but during execute() it throws a NullPointerException in doExecuteWithResult() (line 220, a call to setLocation(Point)). The problem is that doExecuteWithResult() does not ensure that the local variable "CreateConnectionViewRequest req" is non-null before dereferencing it. Specifically, it will be null when: (a) the original request is a simple CreateConnectionRequest, or (b) typeInfoAdapter.getAdapter(IElementType.class) returns null (there seems to be a missing "return"), or (c) the original request is a CreateUnspecifiedTypeConnectionRequest that contains no CreateConnectionViewRequest (a naive reading looks like the latter could even throw a ClassCastException).
Even if it is reasonable to create a DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand with a simple CreateConnectionRequest (that is, one that is neither a CreateConnectionViewRequest nor a CreateUnspecifiedTypeConnectionRequest; case (a) above), canExecute() should return false for all of those cases listed above in which execution would fail.

A similar problem exists when the request does not identify a source and/or target edit part: canExecute() returns true, but execution fails with an exception like this:
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.commands.DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand.getSourceEditPart(DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand.java:175) at org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.commands.DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand.doExecuteWithResult(DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand.java:230) ...

I'm running this code in a COM server. The COM server starts a JVM, which pulls in SWT. The first time I call the server, it successfully displays a dialog for me, the second time I call it I get this fault.

I will be doing some more complete testing in the next couple of days. But the crash I was seeing was totally consistent, and simple to repro, so I think things look good.
Thanks.
Ok, I'm going to close this for now. I believe your problem was fixed along with bug 150782. Please reopen this bug report if you start crashing again.

bug.short_desc: [Presentations] Can't detach a fast view

long_desc.thetext: I thought that a workaround for a fast view not having any memory of its former size would be to "detach" the fast view. It appears that detached view and fast view are mutually exclusive. Seems to me that allowing a fast view to also be detached, and of course having the window size and position be remembvered, would be a helpful feature. A detached fast view might also go far to solving some of the problems with overlapping detached views.

Fast views and detached views are mutually exclusive, and there are no plans to merge to the 2 concepts.
But Eric has been working in that area, what do you think?
PW

Thanks Paul, you are correct that they are two different animanls.
Fast Viewsa are for views that you want to work with transiently (i.e. selecting a "Search" result) where, once the action on the view is complete you don't need it anymore.
Detached Windows are essentially support for multi-monitor folks that want to place views onto the second monitor.
BTW, It's detached windows that don't have a memory of previous sizes/locations, fast views maintain this correctly (I think...;-). see bug 80266 & bug 88382.
Thanks for the suggestion but I think we should keep the two concepts separate.

Here is the situation: Sometimes during debugging I want the console window to be large, other times I don't. I tried using a fast view, but the large size of the console pane is not retained (perhaps this is a bug). So, I thought I'd use a detached window, which overlaps most of the eclipse frame but not the app I am debugging. However, because it is not a fast view, I can't just click on an icon at the bottom of the frame to open it up and, once open, the only single click option is to close/destroy the detached window, not minimize it.
The fundamental idea of any GUI is to make the features that are used the most the easiest ones to use. During debugging, I often need to switch between a large console view and a large debug trace/code/variables view (i.e. the typical "debug" view). It would be nice to be able to do the same for other tasks, like editing, that are realestate intensive, without disrupting the basic frame or desktop layout.
It seems to me that your assumption that detached windows are mostly used for multi monitiors is a false one. As I just described, it is yet another way for a user to maximize the effectiveness of limited screen space, whether one screen, two screens, or more. The big advantage of detached windows is that they can be plopped over the main frame and other apps on the desktop without having to change the main frame or desktop layout.
Conceptually, the main difference between a detached view and a fast view is that the former one is detached, floating, and overlapping, and the latter one is embedded, constrained, and non-overlapping. I see no problem with "mixing" the two, since the the goal is to allow the user to quickly open and close special views that take up lots of realestate, whether that view is detached or embedded. You could simply add detached view icons to the same tray as used for the fast view icons, and make the "close" button on a detached view minimize the window, not destroy it. Also, for the sake of "fastness", activating the eclipse frame could also automatically close the detached fast view.
Thus, the presentation choices for any given view would be "normal" versus "fast", and "embedded" versus "detached". A normal view would not change position/size automatically when the view is deactivated, whereas a fast one, whether embedded or detached, would. And, fast views, whether embedded or detached, would be available as icons in the "fast" tray in the app frame.

bug.short_desc: [build.eclipse.org] Need Mysql 5.x and PHP 5.x w/ https support

long_desc.thetext:
Build.eclipse.org currently has PHP 4.3.4 and mysql4.1 (?).
To support migration of cross-project tools moving from emft.eclipse.org to build.eclipse.org (eg., Search CVS & our new release notes query/generator), we'll need the following updated on build.eclipse.org:
* mysql 5.x+ * php 5.x+ (consistency with other Eclipse servers) * compiled support to connect to mysql 5.0+ * compiled support for openssl/https (to be able to do file('https://bugs.eclipse.org/...'))
Please note - there's a rather debilitating mysql bug here, but there's apparently two workarounds available until an actual release is available with the fix in it:
http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=19810 (see comment [30 Oct 11:13] Magnus Svensson and comments thereafter)
Also, I tried to run `mysql` and got:
modelingBuild@utils:~> mysql -bash: /usr/bin/mysql: Permission denied
So hopefully I'll be able to connect to mysql through php, if not at the commandline. Ideally I'd be able to do both php AND commandline (makes setting up tables and users easier).
I know you guys plan to update this box to SLES10, so if these changes can be done thereafter or incorporated into it, that would be fantastic. In the meantime, we'll hack something workable on emft.eclipse.org.

bug.short_desc: Please link to EMF download page instead of to individual release pages

long_desc.thetext:
On a page such as http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R1.5/R-1.5.2-200610261841/, you link to EMF as http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/downloads/drops/2.2.1/R200609210005.
Assuming these pages are generated by PDE, can you change the template to link instead to: http://www.eclipse.org/emf/downloads/?showAll=1&hlbuild=R200609210005#R200609210005
You'll notice that that link causes the required build to be expanded and also anchor-selected.
The added benefit to linking to our downloads page is that we can capture download stats since that page filters all our downloads through the mirror selection page, /downloads/download.php?file=/path/to/zipfile
Thanks!
looks like some EMF innovation, right? Not Eclipse wide?

Correct, it's new to EMF/EMFT/Modeling-MDT, and soon taking over the rest of the Eclipse Modeling project.
That said, most projects have a www.eclipse.org/<project>/downloads/ page you could link to instead of to static zips/pages, or you could use the www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/path/to/their/stuff/ URL to ensure you're feeding people to the mirrors and enhancing their download stats accurately.
Please forward this defect to Bob Frasor, as appropriate.

John:
Spoke with Bob Fraser and shares my confusion as to why this would be a RAD issue when the problem is on the WebTools website at eclipse.org, not ibm.com. ;-)
All that's required to close this bug is to revise the way you publish links to upstream dependencies. See the sample URL http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R1.5/R-1.5.2-200610261841/ where you link to EMF but do not link to a specific build on our downloads page, only to a specific build on a specific mirror. This causes two problems:
a) it drives traffic to download.eclipse instead of the closest/fastest mirror b) it doesn't provide us with traffic tracking since the links are for /path/to/some/zipfile.zip instead of eclipse.org's download stats tracker and mirror selector, download.php?file=/path/to/some/zipfile.zip
All you'd need to do is to extract the buildID from the fully-qualified path to the zip you used to build that WTP driver, and link to our downloads page using that ID instead of to the build's folder.
So, for the example given, you'd link to
http://www.eclipse.org/emf/downloads/?showAll=1&hlbuild=R200609210005#R200609210005
instead of to
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/downloads/drops/2.2.1/R200609210005
Is that such a difficult change?

> Spoke with Bob Fraser and shares my confusion as to why this would be a RAD
Wrong Bob Fraser ... there's another at BEA who's helping with some website stuff.
This bug, though, does rest just with releng.
We actually want to point/link to the exact zip file ... the linking-to-containing folder is an error, somehow.
I have fixed our index page to point to the exact file, like the other "pre-req" files. It should start to show up on build pages tomorrow. (I won't fix "old" ones, since this is a generated page).

I'd still prefer if you'd link to the build's info page rather than to the zip itself. (Maybe someone only wants the runtime, not the whole SDK?)
If you must link to the zip itself, please link through the mirror selection page, http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/tools/emf/... instead of just to /tools/emf/...
That way we get the download stats and users get the fastest available mirror instead of hammering eclipse.org.

The other benefit to linking to hte downloads page instead of to a specific zip, it occurs to me, is that you'll never know that the zip you grabbed has new features that potentially break old behaviours, such as:
http://www.eclipse.org/emf/docs/2.x/whatsnew/merge2.3.html http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/EMF_2.3_Generics
For that Joe User will have to actually look at our downloads page (or docs page, or home page, but I digress). I'm looking at the overall user experience here. Sure, a link to the zip is faster, but may not give them the complete picture.
FYI, EMF has moved from /emf/ to /modeling/emf/ on www.eclipse.org and from /tools/emf/ to /modeling/emf/ on download.eclipse.org. Please update links accordingly.

bug.short_desc: bugzilla should connect with SSH just like CVS

long_desc.thetext:
Most development shops run their bugzilla and CVS on the same server. This is also the basis for many perl CVS/bugzilla integration solutions.
Proposal: make connecting to bugzilla possibe using the same SSH pipe and configuration/password used by Team/CVS. Right now I need two pipes: one EXTSSH for CVS and one Putty pipe with terminal to run bugzilla. One of them is always timed out :(

There isn't a generic way to access all the necessary information from each provider so I don't think your proposal will work.
Regarding the timout problem, perhaps setting the tasklist to refresh more frequently would help minimize this? It would be great if you could contribute steps for tunneling configuration to http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Network_and_proxy_server_troubleshooting since there are others who would benefit. Thanks Maarten!

BTW, there is a flag in putty to keep connection alive (something like send a ping periodically). Though I can see how ssh tunneling could be useful and even helped to make it work for Team/CVS myself, but I've been using Socks support instead...
OK, I'll work with whats there

The added benefit to linking to our downloads page is that we can capture download stats since that page filters all our downloads through the mirror selection page, /downloads/download.php?file=/path/to/zipfile

(In reply to comment #2) > Change made to > http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/releaseinfo/4.4/support.html
Cool, except that the 2.2 and 2.3 links are the same and the version you're linking to for 2.2 has been archived. If you want to point people to 2.2.1, you should link to:
http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/?project=emf#archives
Or, just link to EMF 2.2.3:
http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/?project=emf&hlbuild=R200705141058#R200705141058
For 2.3.0, I'd suggest just the top of the page, eg:

(In reply to comment #3) > Nick, is there a comparable link (PDE) for the SDK, GEF etc?
To link to PDE, use the main Eclipse downloads pages. For GEF, link to *their* downloads pages.
http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/ http://download.eclipse.org/tools/gef/downloads/
(etc.)
You could also link to the Callisto / Europa discovery sites so people can get their bits that way.
http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/ http://download.eclipse.org/releases/europa/

Okay, so I tried these links and our tools won't accept them. It will accept http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/ but not http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/*
So I can either link to the high-level download site or to a zip file. I have refreshed with the former for the time being because the latter doesn't give you the download stats that you want.
Thoughts?

(In reply to comment #5) > Okay, so I tried these links and our tools won't accept them. It will accept > http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/ but not > http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/*
Did you try escaping the ? and the & so they render correctly? Why won't your tools accept a valid URL with a querystring?
> So I can either link to the high-level download site or to a zip file. I have > refreshed with the former for the time being because the latter doesn't give > you the download stats that you want.
If you want to link to a specific zipfile, feel free, but bear in mind these are subject to deletion (ie., when a release build is available, Stables and Integrations are toasted). Just link through the mirror selection page, thus:
Instead of a direct link:
http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/emf/downloads/drops/2.3.0/S200705230200/emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.3.0RC1.zip
Use:
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/modeling/emf/emf/downloads/drops/2.3.0/S200705230200/emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.3.0RC1.zip
By redirecting through the mirror selection page, we get the stats and you can direct people to a specific zipfile. Or, you could provide multiple links (like we do) to:
a) the project's website, b) the project's downloads page, AND c) the specific zip (so they can choose runtime or SDK)
For an example of this, see the UML2 Tools downloads page, http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/mdt/downloads/?project=uml2tools, under any given build's "Build Dependencies" section.
FYI, more discussion on this topic is in bug 164519.
Thanks Nick. Those tips worked. I used a combo of the escape and the zip from the mirror sites. I will have the build team update the download page to match my changes and then close this defect.
Update to EMF 2.2.4

Nick, I have updated the 4.4 JRE and OS Support Statement File to point to the mirror sites. We have not done the same for our download page because the build scripts use the same file locations and can't make use of a mirror site. We will look for a workaround to this but it will have to be post-4.4 as we are now in stop ship mode.

I have updated the build.properties, customtargets.xml, wsdmcustomtargets.xml and drop.html.template to point to the mirror url.
All links have been updated for the download page in the template for builds from 4.4.1 to point to the projects' mirror sites. Released builds 4.4.0, 4.4.0.1 point to the mirror site of the GA projects. The results should be available for verification starting on a 4.4.1 build from August 8 (e.g. TPTP-4.4.1-200708080100).

bug.short_desc: Creating Filesystem Group involve incorrect error message

long_desc.thetext:
For build APERI-20061113-105408.ZIP, test case DATA MANAGER REPORTING - 13, Data Manager -> Reporting -> Groups -> Filesystem Right click on Filesystem and select "Create Filesystem Group" Select a filesystem from the "Available" box and move to the "Current Selections" When clicking the computer, and when move to the right box, a popup with "Error -- Server: IBM-F87ACAA4DE7 Status: 12 11/14/06 12:10:55 PM SRV0199E: FileSystem Group for Reporting 1 is not associated with an agent." showed.
After ok it, the new group can be saved, and reported by.
The error message should be eliminated. An alternate path: data manager->monitoring->groups to create file system group does not involve this error message.
Screen shot in Aperi IDVT TTT db, test case DATA MANAGER REPORTING - 13, View

(In reply to comment #0) > For build APERI-20061113-105408.ZIP, > test case DATA MANAGER REPORTING - 13, > Data Manager -> Reporting -> Groups -> Filesystem > Right click on Filesystem and select "Create Filesystem Group" > Select a filesystem from the "Available" box and move to the "Current > Selections" > When clicking the computer, and when move to the right box, > a popup with "Error -- Server: IBM-F87ACAA4DE7 Status: 12 > 11/14/06 12:10:55 PM SRV0199E: FileSystem Group for Reporting 1 is not > associated with an agent." showed. > > After ok it, the new group can be saved, and reported by. > > The error message should be eliminated. An alternate path: data > manager->monitoring->groups to create file system group does not involve this > error message. > > Screen shot in Aperi IDVT TTT db, test case DATA MANAGER REPORTING - 13, View
I was able to successfully reproduce this issue. After some investigation, it appears that the real problem is in the legacy GUI, as opposed to the Data Server. The GUI seems to be sending an invalid / unnecessary request to the Data Server. The following code block appears towards the end of the treeExpanded() method in ReportingFSGroupSelector (org.eclipse.aperi.TStorm.gui):
else if (type == ResourceType.RES_COMPUTER && returnedObjectType == 2) { if (name .nlID2 == Constants.MSCS_VS) sendFSListRequest(ResourceType.RES_REP_FILESYSTEM_GROUP, name.nlID, name.nlClusterID); else sendFSListRequest(ResourceType.RES_REP_FILESYSTEM_GROUP, naem.nlID, name.nlID2) }
Removing the block of code presented above seems to eliminate the issue without breaking the reporting filesystem group creation. As such, I'll make sure it gets eliminated.
Given that repository is currently in a minor state of flux, it may be a week or so before I check in a fix for this issue. I'll update this bug report when a nightly build with my fix is available.
The fix for this issue has been checked into CVS. Per confirmation from Hai-Yann, the problem has been resolved.

Hai-Yann verified resolution of this issue in the following Aperi build: APERI-20061117-143149. Since she is not yet able to update bug report state, she wanted me to mark it as verified on her behalf.
Closing out verified bug report.

Problem: NPE thrown if target file exists but is empty (XML parser can't parse a null node).
Solution: check file.length(); if less than minimum threshhold for valid XML, assume file is blank and regenerate it, rather than trying to parse and insert new XML into it.

bug.short_desc: Usability items for Driver Managment/Editing

long_desc.thetext:
We've encountered a use case where a particular driver template doesn't require any jar files (i.e. a driver template with "empty jar list is OK" set to true). It would be nice to be able to hide the jar list section of the Edit Driver dialog if it isn't needed for a particular driver definition.
We could also hide the Properties area if there are no editable properties for the driver definition.
In some cases, this may end up with the jar list and properties sections hidden and the user just left with the ability to change the name of the driver.
Should we add some additional functionality to the Driver framework, including:
* Give driver developers the option of making their default driver instance read only
* Add additional helper classes for editing of driver properties - such as a Boolean combo box or a String List combo box property descriptor

Brian,
Is this required for 1.5.
Rob

Not necessarily required. Just "nice to have".
(In reply to comment #1) > Brian, > Is this required for 1.5. > Rob

bug.short_desc: trac editor should have a People section

long_desc.thetext: To ensure that it makes the people collaborating on the bug more explicit, and to match the other editors.

I pulled the creation of the people section up to AbstracTaskEditor. I modified the code slightly so that new and removed ccs are stored in RepositoryTaskData for proper offline editing support. In the documentation we need to make very clear that these attributes are artificial (as well as the ADD_SELF_CC attribute) as they are created by the editor. All other attributes are created by connectors and (at least for the case of Trac) map directly to repository attributes.
I have not touched the Bugzilla editor but it should be easy to modify it to use the new attributes and get rid of the duplicate code.
Created an attachment (id=53883) mylar/context/zip
Looks good Steffen, patch applied. Created bug#164733 to address points in comment#1.

bug.short_desc: Events XML Parser not working

long_desc.thetext:
The page generates these errors i have a feeling these are PHP5 errors
Warning: usort() [function.usort]: The argument should be an array
Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach()
Wayne since you wrote the page would you mind digging a bit deeper?

The events.xml file was not well formed so the XML parsing failed.
Specifically, three of the entries had <link> sections that contained ampersands (&). I wrapped these up in <![CDATA[ ]]> sections and the problem went away.
I'm going to open a new bug to get the XML parsing stuff to report when the XML is not well formed.
Moving to Community/Website

bug.short_desc: AC blocks connecction from local host if local host is allowed by name

long_desc.thetext:
When the AC is configued to allow access from a local host by name (eg: <Allow host="xyzMachine") it actually blocks an attempt to profile from a workbench on that local host with the following mesage in the service log:
... msg="Connection refused on socket 1340 on host 169.254.198.66 
" ... <sourceComponentId component="AgentController" componentIdType="TPTPComponent" executionEnvironment="D:\cygwin\home\build\TPTP\4.3.0\TPTP-4.3.0-200611070100\agntctrl\src\transport\TPTPClientCompTL\CCTLServer.c, line 493" instanceId="1004" location="xyzMachine.torolab.ibm.com" locationType="IPV4" processId="1632" subComponent="Client Compatibility TL"
The problem may possibly be related to network name lookup. When I ping xyzMachine from other machines, ping shows it as a 9.26.nnnn.xxxx address but when i ping it from itself, ping shows it as 169.254.198.123.
This problem occurred with the TPTP-4.3.0-200611070100 driver on Windows XP. The steps to reproduce are: 1. Install the Agent Controller on your own Windows XP machine ("xyzMachine" in these steps) 2. Run SetConfig.bat to configure with xyzMachine as the only allowed host -ie: serviceconfig.xml should contain: <Allow host="xyzMachine"/> 3. Start the AC on xyzMachine 4. Start a workbench on xyzMachine 4. Launch any Java program from the workbench and targetted to run on the xyzMachine machine 5. The launch will fail with an error popup (possibly IWAT0008E with a reason of IWAT0007I) 6. Check the refusal message in servicelog.log
At this stage of 4.3, I expect a normal like this to be targeted to 4.4 or later.

Are there multiple network cards in this machine such that it would have two names? When I ping my machine by name locally or from another system, I get the same IP.
Also, has this worked in the past?

Yes, indeed there are multiple cards on the laptop I was using. I just tried again on a desktop with a single card and the testcase works fine (ie: allows the attempt to profile locally). Additionally, of course, the IP is the same for the desktop whether pinged locally or remotely. It looks like you've diagnosed the cause. :-)
As far as working previously, this is the first testpass that I was the one to run this case. I believe that it has worked in the past (no record of failure that I could find) but I also believe that it was probably run previously on a desktop with a single card.

This same problem is likely to appear with the RAC, since the code in new AC doing the host name check was taken from the RAC.
This has likely been around for awhile and simply not seen because combination of specifying local host by name on a multi-IP system didn't occur.
Targetting to 4.4.
Added effort estimate: 2 days
Transferring bugs with 4.4 target to new owner, Igor. If their priority is not set to P1, then the bug is only a stretch item for that release.
Created an attachment (id=74545) patch
Resolving since the patch is checked into CVS

bug.short_desc: Datapool dependent jars need to be separated from plugin jars

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, the Datapool tutorial says to extent the ECLIPSE_HOME variable in order to add the datapool dependent jars to the classpath. This presents 2 problems.
First, it assumes that the TPTP plugins are installed in the base Eclipse directory. If the TPTP plugins are installed in an extension location, the TPTP plugin jars won't be found relative to the ECLIPSE_HOME variable.
Second, this ties the resulting project to a specific TPTP and Eclipse version. The plugin jars include the plugin version in the jar name. Classpath entries referencing these versioned jars will break when Eclipse or TPTP is upgraded to a new version. It also means that all developers on a given project must have the same Eclipse and TPTP version installed.
A better approach might be to create new jars for the Datapool dependencies for distribution. This would be similar to the way that the tptp-models.jar, the common.runner.jar, and the java.runner.jar files are distributed.

TPTP V4.2.2 has yet to be released so I am assuming you are using TPTP V4.2.1. If not, please correct the version.
Correcting the component.
Targeting to future since cannot be contained in 4.4.

As discussed on this week's Test Project call (January 22, 2007), the Test Project will focus on existing P1 - P2/Blocker - Major and P1/Normal and test creation/automation defects (omitting defects dependant on outstanding features) in TPTP 4.4. All other Test Project defects have been targeted to future.
If this defect has been targeted to future and you/originator feel it should be completed in 4.4, please provide the necessary reason as a reply to this comment or a post to the Test Project mailing list (tptp-test-tooling-dev@eclipse.org). We will collectively triage and assess our resources to determine a case-by-case decision.
Correction: The Test Project mailing list is tptp-testing-tools-dev@eclipse.org.

bug.short_desc: Certain GIF images that are displayed via a Label widget are truncated.

long_desc.thetext:
Certain GIF images that are displayed via a Label widget are truncated. This problem seems to occur only on Windows 2000 Stand alone server. Below is the test system information.
Microsoft Windows 2000 server 5.00.2195 Service pack 4
I cannot determine why my specific GIF gets truncated. I tried other GIFs and there were OK. One difference between the GIFs that work and the ones that don't is the ones that don't have transparent attributes.
I have a test plugin that can reproduce the problem. I also have screen captures showing how the image is truncated compared to a good one.
The test plug adds a dummy "Test Wizard" that you can launch. The first page shows the image.
Let me know where I can send the material.

Created an attachment (id=53864) Recreation material
The recreate.zip file contains screen captures that shows what the probem is. There is also a TestPlugin that you can import into your workspace to re-create the problem. You have to run the plugin on a Windows 2000 standalone server with SP4.
Duong, you are running 2000. Can you recreate this and then help me debug it?
Steve, I'm unable to replicate this problem on my machine. I don't see the clipping.
Are you running 3.2.x or 3.3 HEAD? The bug might already be fixed.

I re-ran it using Eclipse 3.2 and I don't see the clipping either.
I'm using: Microsoft Windows 2000 5.00.2195 Service pack 4
Do we have "Windows 2000 server" as described in the bug.

I believe that this is a problem in JFace layout code that is calling SWT. We hacked SWT to put a border around all label widgets. The label is being asked to resize to a size that is smaller than the image (not sure why). It could still be an SWT bug if someone is asking us for the preferred size and we are answering something too small.
Dunong, move to JFAce for now?

bug.short_desc: JIRA connector looses server connection

long_desc.thetext:
After some time of working on a task, I switch back to the "Task List" to update an issue in JIRA but it gives me the error message:
Could not download task data, possibly due to timeout or connectivity problem. Please check connection and try again.
When this happens I have to go back to the "Task Repositories" view, right-click on the JIRA repo, select properties, and press the "Validate Settings" button. Then, I can switch back to the "Task List" view and refresh my JIRA queries. At this point, it seems to take an awful long time for the first query to return a result, but once the first one comes back all the rest return quickly.
There may be other ways to "refresh" the JIRA connection; this is just one way that I found works.
This can result from the task data being missing. Offline persistence of JIRA tasks was added in the 0.9 release (this past weekend). Have you tried the 0.9 release?
Oh, ...based on bug#164549 I'm assuming you're using 0.9. :)

I saw this error too. Seems like a duplicate of some issue I submitted long time ago. Something like login token expired for JIRA core services.
Worst part is that it affects queries too and for those, instead of failing it returns empty result. So, all query hits/tasks disappear.

Mik, Eugene, note that we have a similar problem on the bugzilla side when your ip changes (auth token invalid when ip changes so no longer logged in). My solution thus far has been to relogin and re-submit query if 0 hits returned for queries in the tasklist.
Joseph, Eugene: could this be a case of your IP changing?

Two responses:
Well, I do use VPNs throughout the day, so it would be nice if Mylar were resiliant to that change. Sometimes I *need* to flip between VPN connections to get to different parts of the network to access QA machines to test whether tasks I'm managing via Mylar are indeed fixed in non-dev environments.
That being said, before I even submitted this issue I verified that it works in a pure "time out" sort of way. All I have to do is let Eclipse sit idle for a while, and I'll get that error when I try to access anything JIRA-related. Furthermore, I tried setting the refresh interval for the queries to a low value (3 minutes) hoping that that would keep the connection alive, but it didn't seem to have any effect. It will still throw that error after some idle time.
I don't think so too. It should be easy to reproduce. Create Jira query and let it run every 20 minutes after restarting Eclipse. In my case, after few hours query hits are gone...
It takes less than an hour of idle to reproduce it here.
I may have fixed this for tonight's dev build. Will keep an eye on it.

We didn't cut a dev build last night due to additional fixes that needed to be made. Plan on cutting one this evening. I can no longer reproduce this so please let reopen if you see it after installing that build.
Created an attachment (id=54445) mylar/context/zip

bug.short_desc: duplicateProfile() method does not account for extended properties

long_desc.thetext: duplicateProfile() method does not account for extended properties. When duplicating profiles, information stored in extended properties is not duplicated (e.g. cached version information).
Hey Brian, let me know if you don't have enough time to get to this.
Fixed issue and delivered. Duplicate profile refactoring classes now also duplicate the extended properties of the original profile (i.e. version info).

bug.short_desc: [EditorMgmt] Navigating search results can execute code

long_desc.thetext:
I performed a file text search on a GWT project. The first result was an HTML file and was shown in the editor as expected. The next result was a .bat file. When I press the down arrow on the Search view instead of having a text editor open on the file as expected I see a window briefly flash as the file content is executed. This is not just an unexpected behaviour, it is potentially dangerous and should not happen without at least warning the user.
This may be a more general issue of when a file should be opened using an external process and when a file should be opened entirely within Eclipse.
We open an editor on the file with 'IDE.openEditor(...)'. I completly agree that executing a file instead is dangerous.

This is awkward. In the event that we dont have an editor registered for a certain file type (in this case .bat) we delegate to the OS to edit it. In the case of bat files, it runs it. We can fix this case for known extensions (bat, sh) by binding them to the default text editor but fixing it in general is hard.

bug.short_desc: vm name background is always white

bug.short_desc: [Dialogs] SelectionStatusDialog's status message gets truncated

long_desc.thetext:
3.2
In a subclass of SelectionStatusDialog, the space available for the status message (shown by updateStatus(IStatus)) is only half the space between the help button and the OK/Cancel buttons.
This is due to two reasons: - fStatusLine's layout data does not grab extra horizontal space - the parent for the OK/Cancel buttons does grab extra horizontal space, so even if fStatusLine's is changed to grab extra space, it gets split
The various subclasses of TrayDialog that want to put extra controls between the help button and the OK/Cancel buttons must currently jump through hoops to accomplish this (e.g. temporarily calling setHelpAvailable(false) around the call to super.createButtonBar). Dialog or TrayDialog should be given extra protocol for adding extra buttons to the left of the regular OK/Cancel buttons, so that subclasses don't have to worry about the alignment of the regular buttons (they would always be right-aligned). By default this area would include the Help button (if help's available), but subclasses could extend to add extra controls (like the message line in SelectionStatusDialog).

Created an attachment (id=53876) Test plugin showing the problem
- import the plugin into your workspace - run the target - use the sample action to open the dialog - resize it a bit larger - you'll see that the status message gets clipped to only half the available space

Created an attachment (id=53877) Screen shot of the test plugin running
The colours show the composite nesting structure. From outside in: cyan (composite created in SelectionStatusDialog.createButtonBar) blue (composite created in TrayDialog.createButtonBar) red (composite created in Dialog.createButtonBar)
StatusDialog likely has the same problem. Seems like SelectionStatusDialog should be a subclass of StatusDialog anyway.
I guess SelectionStatusDialog doesn't extend StatusDialog since it must also extend SelectionDialog.
A workaround is to use setStatusLineAboveButtons(true).
I'll take this as we are currently looking at the truncation issue in general

While looking at this, I noticed that the Search also overrides createButtonBar in a couple of their dialogs (e.g. to add the Customize...) button in the Search dialog, but they completely replace the implementation rather than deal with the complexity of calling super. Should look at these cases to see if extra protocol (as suggested above) would help.

bug.short_desc: SEI interface is not generated

long_desc.thetext:
I have problems in generating Java (client and/or server) for a WSDL (tried with several wsdls) - no matter what options I choose in the "JAX-WS->Generate Code" wizard the generated code cannot be compiled due to a missing methods or interfaces genrated. In particular I miss the SEI while the implementation tries to "implement" that interface.
Example: Get the wsdl: http://java.sun.com/webservices/docs/2.0/samples/fromwsdl/etc/AddNumbers .wsdl Generate: implemnation and client
Then you get the impl generated:
public class AddNumbersPortTypeImpl implements AddNumbersPortType { ...
And this AddNumbersPortType interface is not generated.

This is from Bogdan:
have currently fixed this issue locally by:
Adding the env.put(ToolConstants.CFG_GEN_SEI, ToolConstants.CFG_GEN_SEI); To the CeltixWsdlToJavaGenerator's run method
Thus the SEIGenerator.passthrough() will return false and the SEIGenerator.generate() method does not exit and generates the SEI ...
All the generated stuff is then compileable. Maybe someone could take a look at this fix and commit it to the cvs if it is appropriate to be fixed like this.

The current service creation part only support Java-First mode. That means user write SEI class with annotations. the Java->WSDL builder will be called to generate WSDL file once they have @WebService annotation.
To support WSDL-First mode: * integrate with WTP wsdl editor. (Maybe need some extensions/customization support from WTP) * generate SEI class when call wsdltojava as Bordan point out. * disable the Java->WSDL builder.
The WSDL-First mode support will be part of this milestone (Dec 18th)

Fixed by setting to generate SEI if it doesn't exists under the project.
This need to be revisit during supporting WSDL-FIRST mode. In that case, after user modify the WSDL file, we need to generate SEI class again.

bug.short_desc: [Regression]Number is not selected in Insert Grid dialogue [0000]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Number is not selected in Insert Grid dialogue.

In linux, the spinner is focused and selected by default, but in windows, it's only focused, not selected. It's OS related, not controled by us. So I don't think it's a bug.
You said it's a regression bug, and was fixed before. Yes, that's right. Formerly, the Sipinner is written by GUI, which is composed of a text control and two buttons. In order to fix it, we can call the API Text.selectAll(). But now it doesn't work, that's because now we use org.eclipse.swt.widgets.spinner instead, and we don't have any public API to select the text. Set this bug to WONTFIX.

bug.short_desc: Move a root ContentPackage 'C1' to another root ContentPackage 'C2' as a son, then 'C1' can not be deleted.

long_desc.thetext:
Not a regression.
Step: 1. Create two ContentPakages in a same level, name C1 and C2
Content Packages | C1 | C2
2. Move C1 to C2, then C1 become a sub content package of C2 ---> problem: 1. Context Menu to C1, "delete" item is disabled 2. Key 'del' also does not take effect on C1
Remark: 1. if you Copy C1 to C2, no such problem 2. This kind of problem only for root contentpackage, move a sub one has no problem

The item provider of root content packages has an irregular parent, Content Packages, which is an UI folder and is not its container. A separate reference is kept to Content Packages and this must be cleared when the content package is moved to a sub content package. This was not done and caused this bug.
Fix verified on build 20070304-2254.
Verified and fixed on epf1.2 20070313-1730.

bug.short_desc: Unselecting 'enable Tomcat debug mode' should remove -debug

long_desc.thetext:
Using WTP 1.5.2 I create a new server to Tomcat 5.5. Open the server configuration and select the 'Enable Tomcat debug mode (v4.x and above only)' box. Save the server config. Select 'Open launch configuration'. Go to Arguments, and see that the Program Arguments have added a command, so that it now says, "start -debug"
Uncheck the 'Enable Tomcat debug mode (v4.x and above only)' box. Save the server config. Select 'Open launch configuration' again. Go to Arguments, and see that the Program Arguments still has the command: "start -debug"
I would expect this "-debug" argument to be removed if 'enable Tomcat debug' mode is turned off.
I believe this is a duplicate of a similar bug.

Attempts to preserve user added program arguments inadvertently preserves the "-debug" argument, and if it appears after the "start" argument, Tomcat 5.0 and 5.5 servers fail to start. As mentioned in the duplicate bug, this option is useless in Tomcat 5.0 and 5.5. In WTP 2.0, I should be able to support differences between server editors for different versions of Tomcat, so the Debug option won't even appear for Tomcat 5.0 and later servers.
Removing the "-debug" manually from the launch configuration is the only work around after unchecking the Debug option.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 108482 ***
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version. If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

bug.short_desc: Unable to start Tomcat in debug mode

long_desc.thetext:
Using WTP 1.5.2 I have started a new workspace. Create a new server to Tomcat 5.5. Open the server configuration and select the 'Enable Tomcat debug mode (v4.x and above only)' box. Save the server config. In the servers view, select the Tomcat server and select Debug. => The server does not start. The server console says, "Oct 4, 2006 5:35:16 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap main WARNING: Bootstrap: command "-debug" does not exist."
Open up the server config, and select 'Open launch configuration'. Go to Arguments, and see that the Program Arguments have added a command, so that it now says, "start -debug"
I think this is a known issue - Tomcat v5.5 does not support this debug argument and it needs to be removed/disabled.

Like Bug 164570, it's the same issue. User program argument preservation doesn't properly deal with the order of arguments. Since this option is useless in Tomcat 5.0 and later, the easy workaround is to uncheck the option and manually remove the "-debug" from the launch parameters.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 108482 ***
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version. If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

bug.short_desc: [ds] Declarative services resolver is not thread safe causing ConcurrentModificationException

long_desc.thetext:
Calling newInstance on the ComponentFactory service provided by org.eclipse.equinox.ds_1.0.0 bundle, under high concurrent load causes java.util.ConcurrentModificationException.
To reproduce, simply run many threads in an OSGi SCR, each of which tries to create new component instances. The stack trace observed looks like the following:
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.checkForComodification(AbstractList.java:4 49) at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.next(AbstractList.java:420) at org.eclipse.equinox.ds.resolver.Resolver.resolveSatisfied(Resolver.ja va:588) at org.eclipse.equinox.ds.resolver.Resolver.justResolve(Resolver.java:55 4) at org.eclipse.equinox.ds.service.ComponentFactoryImpl.newInstance(Compo nentFactoryImpl.java:74) ...
Bug #181858 includes a fix for this bug.

The ProSyst DS impl does not have any open timing or deadlock issues against it. I would say that it is thread safe. Since the ProSyst's contributed DS is the Equinox DS implementation now, I change the resolution of the bug to worksforme.

However, during development, WTP reports problems when I try to use tags from this jar in my jsps. Content assist doesn't work, and validation doesn't work. I get warnings for unknown tags.
Fixed in 1.5.5.

bug.short_desc: Existing activity not in the xml import lib does not get removed

long_desc.thetext:
1. Create an activity under a cp 2. Export the lib as xml 3. Add a sencond activity under the cp 4. Import the xml lib exported in step 2, either with "overwrite" or "merge" option.
Expected result: the 2nd activity should get removed. Actual result: the 2nd activity does not get removed. The behavor is inconsistent with the regular plugin import and regular config import.

The cause is in handling "isMany" features like "breakdownElements" -> the behavor is implemented as always "merge". This also causes a similar issue with the imported result of an existing configuration when the import option is "overwrite".
Fixed in UmaLib
Fixed verified on EPF1.2 build 20070313-1730. Please close it.
Verified. Closed.
Part of the fix has been broken by the fix for 186469. I will deliver a fix for it. Reopening this bug so that QA can retest it. Thanks.
Fix delivered. When verifing, please try both "overwite" and "merge" options. Thanks.

Verified this defect on EPF 1.2 build 20070605-1122 and reopen again.
The EPF can't closed when import the exported xml file when select the option 'Merge imported content into the existing method library'
Steps: 1. Create an activity under a cp 2. Export the lib as xml 3. Add a second activity under the cp 4. Import the xml lib exported in step 2,select the "merge" option -->Problem: (1) The imported function can't finished for long time (2) Can't closed the 'import xml' wizard window

Caused by an infinite loop. Fixed by calling TngUtil.getParentMethodPackage instead of TngUtil.getMethodPackage in UmaLibrary.deleteElements.
Jun, Thanks for spotting this out.
Fix is verified on Daily build 20070608-0000 and fixed.

bug.short_desc: Add proxy configuration as task repository settings option

long_desc.thetext: -Add proxy settings (with authentication) to repository settings page -Ensure refactored to get proxy from new settings rather than the platform -Add proxy authentication credentials to client in HttpClient.setupHttpClient()
Repository setting page is getting quite busy. Should we allow to have more then one page in repository preferences or use something like Team repository is using (with tree navigator on the left)...
What if we use a similar approach to what you've done with the web connector settings page (as Mik suggested). We could put both http auth and proxy configuration in the collapsed advanced section.
I think it was a total hack and separate page would be really more intuitive. Besides, it is hard to deal with dialog size when that area is expanded.
Okay, I'll consider adding an additional 'advanced' tab...
Please check Team/Repository properties UI. Mylar should use the same kind of dialogs.

I'm torn on what's better. Visually I find the folding better because it has the "details on demand" property and is a less disturbing interaction than switching tabs, makes it easy to click validate settings, etc. Note that the JDT compiler settings make effective use of this.

If I remember correctly we agree that per repository proxy configuration was not needed. We could add a proxy settings page to the global Mylar preferences (equivalent to Team/CVS/Proxy Setting) and put a link on the repository properties page "Configure proxy settings" for easy access.
BTW, the advanced web repository configuration overlaps with the parameter table when expanded on my system.

Well, at least one concern is if different proxies are needed we wouldn't have the facility for it. In addition Mik mentioned that we would like to keep all the networking/repository settings in one place. For the first pass I'm just going to add it to the current settings page in similar fashion to what you see on the Java > Compiler > Building preference page (expandable sections). Later (if necessary) we can beef it up into what can be found in the CVS Repositories properties dialog as Eugene suggests. Regarding the settings, Mik suggested that the new section have a check box that indicates that the install/update proxy settings are being used (default) and that deselection will allow user to enter custom proxy settings for that particular repository.

Rob, Mik, please consider not to use expandable sections. At first those seem really cool, but after a second look I think they have usability issues. Also note that compiler use them more for grouping but here we need completely separate form. So, I believe that multipage properties dialog (see Console properties, Editor properties, Team/CVS repository properties, or global Properties) is a much better fit.
Fixed. Please feel free to open a bug report to address UI issues related to lengthly settings pages.
Created an attachment (id=54200) mylar/context/zip

long_desc.thetext:
Description: the javascript function-localComapre don't work
Build Number: 2.2.0.v20061115-1059
Steps to reproduce: 1. new a report 2. create a data on the layout, and input "JavaScript".localeCompare("javascript"); 3. save and preview
Actual result: an error is thrown out There are errors evaluating script ""JavaScript".localeCompare("javascript");".

This is not a bug. BIRT will not support localeCompare method as far as Rhino do not support it.

bug.short_desc: Corrections to GLA ISV help documentation files

long_desc.thetext:
The following changes should be made to the GLA ISV help documentation files in org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.doc.isv:
tsetuppluginproj.html - "Provider Name" should be "Plug-in Provider"
tconfiguresensor_rules.html - In step 5 - should clarify that if no value is specified, the default value is 90. Also add a Hint: If the log file does not have a footer, it is recommended that this value be set to 0.
tcrglacomp.html - under "Extract the Generic Log Adapter source code" change "/home/tptp" to "/cvsroot/tptp"
These are not stop ship issues for the documentation in 4.3. Deferring to 4.4.

Another suggested change to tconfiguresensor_rules.html
Add the following hint to "4. In the Maximum blocking field, type the number of lines you want the sensor to process before passing the information to the extractor."
Hint: The Maximum blocking value may affect the performance of log file parsing. For example, for log files with multiple lines per record, setting Maximum blocking to a size large enough to include all of the lines of a typical record will improve parsing performance.

Created an attachment (id=55438) Patch
I've attached the patch for you're review.
The attached patch contains changes for this defect and bugzilla 161795. I only committed the fixes to the files mentioned in this defect to TPTP Head CVS.

This was fixed in 4.4 i1.
Aman, thanks for this patch.

bug.short_desc: [Regression] No respond when set large number in filter TOPN[0702]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Set a large number(for example, 3444444) in the "value1" of filter topN. When preview the data in the "Edit dataset" dialog, it keeps processing and no respond. If cancel the operation, no reaction too.
Build Number: 2.2.0.v20061115-1059
Step to reproduce: 1.new a datasource and a dataset 2.in the dataset add a filter with top N 3.enter 3655566 in top n 4.click the "Preview Results"
Actual result: It keeps processing. Can not cancel the operation. Expected result: If the number is larger than the record number, shall return the whole result set immediately. And at the same time, user could cancel the operation.
The algorithm used to do TopN/BottomN filter in data set editor is polished so that the large N value would no longer lead to long time no responding.
resolved.

bug.short_desc: [Regression]Insert a chart from different methods, Undo and Redo menu contents are different.[00]

long_desc.thetext:

bug.short_desc: [hashcode/equals] Generated equals() is broken when using Hibernate

long_desc.thetext:
The generated code for equals() contains:
if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) return false;
Unfortunately, when you use Hibernate, this can be false even if you compare an object to itself!
The reason for this is that Hibernate creates derived class instances on the fly with CGLIB. One place where this happens is if you have an object with children which contain back references.
If you navigate parent->child->parent, the second parent object can have a different class as the first because Hibernate has to inject code to implement lazy loading (Hibernate creates a new class which contains proxy code which loads the objects from the database when you call the getter for the first time).
Unfortunately, there is no good solution. Usually with the Java contract, two objects of a different class cannot be equal.
If you have "class B extends A {}" (ie. a new class which doesn't change the behavior of A since it doesn't add new methods or fields), then one could argue that all objects of B are in fact of the same class as A.
As a next step, are two objects different if their business key is the same?
For example if I create a derived class which adds code to display the object in a UI but doesn't change the behavior. Since I can exclude fields from the generated equals() code, I would argue that they are the same.
Therefore, can you please change the generated code to:
if (!(obj instanceof A) ) return false;
This would make sure the cast works. If you don't want to make this the default, please add an option to the field selection dialog.
And last but not least, please use the getters to access the field values (for the same reason) or add an option for this. With Hibernate, all fields are always "null" because the getters contain some magic.
Also, given the Java idea of getters, you should never assume that it's save to use the fields directly when a getter exists.

The 'instanceof' option got added for 3.3 (see bug 129547) The suggestion of supporting getters is in bug 153738.
I hope it's ok if I set this as a dup of bug 153738
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153738 ***

bug.short_desc: Add a save option to control XMLHelper's deresolve behavior

long_desc.thetext: *** Bug 164592 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=53930) Patches to support a URIHandler
So the idea is to create a derived URIHandlerImpl in order to specialize the behavior of resolve and deresolve. This default implementation should do exactly what would be done without this option. It could be specialized to map URIs to different locations or just to tweak the behavior or deresolve itself. I think this is pretty complete and ready to go. What do you think?

Hi Ed, What I do not yet understand is how the uri's are used at load time. For example the current way of setting the nsuri in the resource just before save, how is this resolved when loading and how would this work in the new scenario.
My original thought was that there would be something like an EObjectResolver. Which would get an uri (the href) and return an instance of an EObject. The default impl. would read a resource and read the EObject from there, other impls would read the EObject in another way. This differs from the approach you propose I think which operates at a higher level (resolve uri -> read resource) instead of the individual EObject level.
Or do I miss/oversee something with my initial idea?
gr. Martin

Martin,
Sorry, I didn't see your comment because I didn't add myself to the CC list. The idea here is to have control over the syntactic manipulate on the URI as it's resolved (made absolute) during load and deresolved (made relative) during save. The actual resolving of proxies is handled by ResourceSet.getEObject and could be specialized by specializing that method of the resource set. Also BasicEObjectImpl.eResolveProxy (the object referencing the proxy) will get a chance to intercept before it gets to the resource set.
The completed changes have been committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: [CellEditors] Can not navigate tables (cells) using keyboard

long_desc.thetext: I can not navigate a table (in a wizard), select its cells, activate cell-editors using the keyboard. Is this a known issue? Is there any key combination to do this? If not, what is the work-around?
yes see bug #151295 I think this could be closed as duplicate of this bug if you agree

the only work around coming to my mind is to register a key listener and mouse listener on the table, to track of the currently selected cell and activating CellEditor using table.editElement(Object,int) on certain key combinations.

(In reply to comment #1) > yes see bug #151295 I think this could be closed as duplicate of this bug if > you agree
I am not sure; the bug #151295 only talks about activating cell-editors but not about selecting cells. I have the same question about the work-around you have suggested. If the user can't even select a parcitular cell he/she wants to edit what do we achieve by attaching a key-listener ? Please clarify.

1. Indeed it doesn't talk explicity about navigation but that's implied by the fact that when we want to support activation by key board we must track cell-selection using the keyboard where from should be else know from which cell-editor to activate.
2. MouseListener: - selection cells and activating CellEditor
KeyBoardListener: - navigating table/tree using e.g. arrow keys (remembering currently selected cell) - activating appropriate cell-editor
Another thing which works and I think someone I supported on newsgroups did that is the use of a TableCursor.
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet96.java
3. For further discussion I'd say lets use the platform.rcp-newsgroup and not bugzilla.
by the way bug #151377 talks about cell-selection interface which might provide the foundation for your request one day or another.

Carolyn,
Karice said that this is a known issue and that there's a (albeit non-intuitive) way to get this to work (in 3.2). It's essentially about keyboard navigating inside a TreeViewer with columns. Does this ring any bells??
Thanks
Created an attachment (id=55705) A ZIP file containing a project that adds a 'New Wizard' showing the issue

To test, unpack the ZIP somewhere, fire up eclipse and Import Existing Project (opinting to where you unzipped).
Fire up an inner (debug) session and do 'File->Import->Other->TestImportWizard' You should see a page containing a Table.
BTW, ZIP'd code uses "TableViewer", -not- "TreeViewer" as I had previously said.

Regarding comment 6 - sorry, Eric, no bells are ringing.
Cells cannot be selected in native Tables or native Trees with columns, using either the mouse or the keyboard. TableViewer and TreeViewer would need to implement this functionality themselves.
I do not know if they maybe already implement some way to navigate cells as part of the cell editing code. To determine that, you'll have to grok through TableViewer and TreeViewer.
Don't forget to add the accessibility keyword for accessibility bugs.

Created an attachment (id=55837) A KeyListener workaround that does not work
As a workaround, I am trying to use a KeyListener to capture left-arrow and right-arrow keystrokes and activate one of two cell-editors (depending on the key); I call TableViewer.editElement(element, column) method to activate the cell-editors. But this method does not seem to work. Can someone take a look at my code and tell me what is wrong?
Please see the attached plugin project TestImportWizard (as zip file) with the description "A KeyListener workaround that does not work" - the class TablePage in particular. It defines an inner class called TableKeyListener in which the keyReleased() method calls TableViewer.editElement().
Thanks in advance, mani

The left and right arrow keys are used for keyboard traversal. Try adding a TraverseListener instead of a KeyListener. A sample snippet that uses a TraverseListener is here: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet241.java
If you are using TableCursor, then move this bug over to SWT and give it to Carolyn. Thanks!
Eric, please find out if we're doing the right thing and update the bug. We should investigate fixing this for 3.2.2.

(In reply to comment #13) > The left and right arrow keys are used for keyboard traversal. Try adding a > TraverseListener instead of a KeyListener. My problem is in using the TableViewer.editElement() to activate the cell-editors; not in capturing key-strokes. The editElement() somehow does not work for me. Please look at the source file TablePage.java (the method TablePage.TableKeyListener.keyReleased()) and see if you can find out what is wrong.

OK, After going to a variety of folks here seeing if this is a known issue and, more importantly, is there a known solution. It turns out that the existing behaviour has always been there so adding it in 3.2.x would constitute a new feature (one that is already under development for 3.3) and we don't usually add features into point releases.
It is, however, possible to roll your own. The best example I can find is the JDT's 'Refactor -> Change Method Signature' which brings up a dialog that allows kepboard navigation and editing. You should be able to get some useful information about how to handle the navigation issues (see the JDT "ChangeParametersControl.createParameterList" for specifics...
Let me know how it goes
I've been told the suggested path is to use the SWT 'TableCursor' to handle this, not the 'hand-rolled' version that the JDT is using (they wrote theirs before the TableCursor came into existence...

(In reply to comment #17) > OK, After going to a variety of folks here seeing if this is a known issue and, ... > JDT's 'Refactor -> Change Method Signature' which brings up a dialog that > allows kepboard navigation and editing. You should be able to get some useful > information about how to handle the navigation issues (see the JDT > "ChangeParametersControl.createParameterList" for specifics... > Let me know how it goes
Hi Eric,
I already tried a workaround which I have mentioned (and attached) here. I looked at the JDT code you mentioned; it calls the same TableViewer.editElement() method that I do. But it doesn't work in my work-around. Can you please look at my code and tell me what could be wrong?
PK, have you looked at using the SWT TableCursor? If not then take a look. The concensus is that this is a better path to take than rolling your own.
Eric will there be anything to do here or should this be closed.

Todd, I think that we've done all we can do on this side by pointing them towards the recommended approach (i.e. using SWT's TableCursor). I'll mark this as fixed since we don't anticipate taking further action on this...
Folks, if you run into bugs in the TableCursor you should open an SWT defect for them...
Please mark as WONTFIX if we aren't going to do anything
Marking as WONTFIX. Feel free to open a new defect if you have problems related to a TableCursor implementation.
